NewValue: Editor's note: In typed font the chop-seal looks like ㄗ but when written it uses the form マ. Take also care to differentiate it from the stamp (卩).
Editor's note: The dot above the sun is optional (it can be seen in some fonts and in some it's omitted)
Editor's note: You can use either 'tongue wagging mouths' 日 or 'prosperous 昌'
Editor's note: In some fonts the 'candle' primitive is written with 小 instead of the usual ⺌
Editor's note: The dot above the sun is optional (it can be seen in some fonts and in some it's omitted)

The element for sun at the bottom is easy enough. The problem is that the top element, row, is an exception to the rule (1.1785) that the two horns at the top are eliminated only when it appears beneath its relative primitive. [10]
Editor's note: ... or instead of overly complicated rules, we could use simple primitives: One can make progress even walking on spikes all day.
Editor's note: In some fonts the 'candle' primitive is written with 小 instead of the usual ⺌
Editor's note: In some fonts the horns are written clearly pointed up, and in some others they are reversed
A swarm of gnats, those tiny drops of pesky insects.
